name: NPR
text:
The bank accounts of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny were frozen and his apartment was "seized" in a civil case while he was in a coma after being poisoned with a nerve agent, his spokesperson says.
https://t.co/95sbsECJa0

text:

text: Bernie Sanders: "This is not just an election between Donald Trump and Joe Biden. This is an election between Donald Trump and democracy ‚Äì and democracy must win." https://t.co/4AAV7j0DtS

name: NPR
text:
RT @throughlineNPR: With the death of RBG, the president is hoping to fill the seat with a conservative justice. And evangelicals, who've played an important role in today's politics, have been waiting for this moment.

How evangelicals became such a powerful voting bloc: https://t.co/GFkxNJ5MAe

name: NPR
text:
A white Maryland man has been sentenced to 25 years in prison for shooting a Black man and reportedly telling him to "go back to Africa." Police linked the gunman to white supremacist groups, the prosecutor said.
https://t.co/xJkQ2rN1Y1

name: NPR
text:
Tamika Palmer broke her silence in an Instagram post today.

"It's still Breonna Taylor for me," she wrote beside a portrait of her daughter, followed by a broken-heart emoji and #ThesystemfailedBreonna.
 https://t.co/GlgVCFRzmW

name: NPR
text:
Gov. Andrew Cuomo has signed an order relieving New Yorkers who receive unemployment benefits from having to report part-time income they receive from working for election boards through Nov. 3.
https://t.co/3Q8nIBaLDT

name: NPR
text:
More than half of the people on federal death row are people of color, a new study finds. The victim‚Äôs race also matters a lot, an advocate notes: 

Defendants who kill white people are 17 times more likely to be executed.
 https://t.co/vqeDDhZBUE

name: NPR
text:
The Pac-12 conference has reversed its decision to halt football, voting unanimously to start the 2020 season on Nov. 6, after arriving at a deal with the COVID-19-test maker Quidel.
https://t.co/2uxPSPZMmY

text:

text: California Gov. Gavin Newsom: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know who the Trump administration is doing bidding for, but they‚Äôre really, really, almost troglodytes in terms of their approach to climate and to the economy and where we‚Äôre going as a nation.‚Äù https://t.co/LKxSKYtnf5

name: NPR
text:
A new report has identified more than 380 suspected detention facilities in China's Xinjiang region, which were built and expanded ‚Äî even as Chinese officials claimed most of the ethnic Uighurs and others sent there had "returned to society."
https://t.co/yyQymzPXi6

name: NPR
text:
When it comes to COVID-19 and pregnancy, an OB-GYN says the virus seems to be able to cross the placenta and infect fetuses ‚Äî but that it "doesn't seem to happen very often."

And, unlike Zika, there isn't evidence of an association with birth defects.
https://t.co/u8KXhpRhKL

text:

text:

text: We asked mourners who paid their respects to Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg at the Supreme Court to reflect on the imp‚Ä¶ https://t.co/F0RiTqCMg0

name: NPR
text:
People are getting creative this Halloween. 

"Some of the ideas I've heard are: setting up a chute made of long cardboard tubes or plastic piping, then sending candy down the tubes," a mom says. "Or possibly a clothesline in the yard with candy attached."
